meta.subject: English Language
meta.philosophy: Quality, life long education for all which is accessible, inclusive and relevant to individual, national and global needs
meta.competence_learning: The Syllabus intends to develop the learners’ communicative competence in English Language including other skills of listening and speaking, reading and writing. Teachers are; therefore, encouraged to use methods that can improve the learners’ ability to use English Language accurately and appropriately.
goals: Develop essential skills in listening, reading, speaking, writing, creating, and reflecting upon increasingly intricate spoken, written, and multimodal texts.
Foster accuracy, fluency, and purpose in communication, aligning with the Competence-Based Curriculum of the 21st Century.
Instil knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes, nurturing children to become productive and beneficial members of both their communities and Zambian society.
Enhance language skills for effective communication and learning across various subjects.
